Fields.DialogueText: And one and two, and three and two, and one and two, and three!
What's going on out here?
Hello, Kanchou. I'm just leading the crew through some exercises.

Fields.MenuText: Exercises? It just looks like they're stretching.
Is that why you're screaming? I could hear you from the bowels of the ship.
Are you forcing them to do this, or is it voluntary?

Fields.DialogueText: It's calisthenics, Kanchou. It's important to keep your body limber and flexible. You can't run or jump if you can't move your legs.
Arigatō. I just know how to project my voice.
No one is here who doesn't want to be. Having a lazy good for nothing join us would suck all the fun out of it.
Do you do this every day?
I do it when I have the time. Sometimes I'm a little too busy and someone leads in my place.
It's unusual, but it seems like the ship's still in working order, so I guess there's no harm in it.
*ALARM*
You speak of harm, and the Funayūrei show up. You may have a touch of misfortune about you, Captain.
It's not just me. The whole world was unlucky enough to get infested by these bastards.
@BATTLE
Another wave of Morganas coming in hot!
@BATTLE
I have to say, you're quite speedy, Ikazuchi.
I can assure you that I'm the fastest ship in the Fleet.

Fields.MenuText: I have a feeling you're right about that.
Is that cockiness, or confidence?
I'm not quite sure that's true.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm happy to hear your intuition can be trusted, sir.
I assure you, it's confidence. I know exactly what I'm capable of, Kanchou.
Are you calling me a liar?
Captain, we're running low on supplies.
That's the downside of being so fast. You burn through supplies at an impressive rate.
Every boon has its price.
It might be expensive, but it could certainly be worse.
Exactly. Now let's hurry and resupply so we can get back to our task of destroying Funayūrei.
Hmph. Hmph. Hmmmph.
Uh, Ikazuchi? Are you trying to climb up the doorway or something?
Oh, hello there, Kanchou. I'm just competing against myself. I'm trying to beat my old record.
Your... jumping record?
Yes. I've been improving slowly and steadily. I'd like to eventually reach the ceiling.
Hmmm... let me give that a try...
You mean like that?
That was so easy for you. How did you do that?

Fields.MenuText: I'm just taller than you.
I've been secretly practicing for years so I could defeat you on this day.
It's not that hard. It's just jumping.

Fields.DialogueText: I can't argue with that. There's nothing I can do about my height.
We haven't known one another for years, Kanchou.
There's a little more to it than that, you know.
*ALARM*
Can you jump later? We've got Funayūrei to fight off.
I can do both, but not from here. Let's go.
@BATTLE
Okay, get everything on the list. Twice as much even, if you think we can hold it.
I'll get right on it, sir.
You wanted to see me, Kanchou?
*sigh* I wanted to see your face, not your feet...  Is there a reason you're walking around on your hands?
Sorry about that. I was exercising my arms. Did you need something?
Actually, that's what I wanted to talk about. I've been getting reports that you've been doing that sort of thing in the middle of battle.
Just because we're fighting ship to ship doesn't mean my Belle form needs to take a breather. Is that a problem?

Fields.MenuText: Yes. I'd prefer it if your head was completely in the battle.
No, I just wanted to make sure it wasn't impeding your performance in battle.
As long as we stay alive you can do whatever you want.

Fields.DialogueText: My head is in the battle. You seem to have a problem with what I'm doing with my body.
You don't have to worry about that. If exercising was a hindrance, I would put an end to it myself.
I appreciate your trust in me, Kanchou. I will remember that.
*ALARM*
That's not good. Do we have enough supplies left for one more fight?
I can make do with what we have. They don't seem like much of a threat.
That's what I like to hear.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Sir, there's another group of Morganas headed our way.
How are our supplies?
Dwindling, sir.
We have more than enough, Kanchou. We hardly used anything in that last battle.
We used more than you thought.
Do we fight or run? We need to decide now.
We fight.

Fields.MenuText: Are you sure?
Hey, I'm the captain here.
You heard the lady.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm always sure.
I know. I'm sorry, we just need to make the call quickly.
Yeah, like Kanchou said, you heard me.
All right, we're going in.
Yes, sir.
I hope your pride doesn't cost us our lives.
It's not pride, Kanchou. If I thought there was a chance that we'd lose, I wouldn't let us go anywhere near this battle.
Still, I hope we don't die.
I know we won't.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, we're about to start a round of calisthenics! Would you care to join us?

Fields.MenuText: You mean your stretching stuff? No thanks, I'm fine.
It sounds interesting, but I'm a little busy at the moment.
I'd love to. Do I have a second to finish up a little work?

Fields.DialogueText: Don't discount it until you attempt it, Kanchou. You might like it.
I don't care what you're busy with. It can wait until after.
Your work will still be there after we're done, and you'll feel a lot better while you're doing it if you stretch first.
All right, I'll tell you what. I'll join your calisthenics. Just lower your voice.
My voice? What are you talking about?
You're practically screaming at me right now. Can't you tell?
I-I am? OH! I'm so sor—I mean...
I'm so sorry, Kanchou. I suppose my voice was just ready to lead the crew. And now you, too.
Just in calisthenics. Don't get any ideas, Ikazuchi.
*ALARM*
It looks like stretching is going to have to wait.
Not necessarily. I can do both.
Well, I'm not going to risk it!
@BATTLE
Ikazuchi, would you quit flipping all over the hall? People are trying to walk here.
I'm small, so I don't take up much of the hall. People can walk around me.

Fields.MenuText: You're not as small as you think.
Have you ever heard the phrase "better safe than sorry"?
I'd love to let you flip all over the ship, but we've been getting a few complaints.

Fields.DialogueText: Did you just call me fat?
Hai, but I'm not sure how it relates to this situation. I'm being very careful.
Complaints? I haven't done anything to make anyone complain. Going to the kanchou instead of coming to me directly is a gross overreaction. Some people...
Look, I don't want you to accidentally hurt yourself or anyone else on board.
I think I'm skilled enough to avoid that, Kanchou. Or do you doubt my abilities?
*ALARM*
Well, it looks like you'll have a chance to use the abilities that really matter in this war.
My gymnastic abilities?
Your ballistic abilities.
@BATTLE
Is it getting cold? I feel like it's been getting colder lately.
Well, we're heading up north. We'll be in the Arctic Ocean soon.
That explains why my teeth won't stop chattering.

Fields.MenuText: Are you okay, Ikazuchi?
Deal with it. It's not that chilly.
I'm not surprised you're so cold, you're hardly wearing anything.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm fine. I'll be fine. I'm not great. I just need to warm up.
I am dealing with it. Dealing with it just makes a chattering sound.
I'm wearing plenty. Anything else and I wouldn't have the mobility I need. I refuse to sacrifice maneuverability for comfort.
Well, if the cold gets to be too much for you, I'm sure there are coats, blankets, or something below deck you can use to warm up.
I'll keep that in mind, but I have my own ways of warming up.
And there she goes, flipping away. Whatever works for her, I guess.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Hello, Kanchou! Are you joining me for lunch today?
Yes, but not for long. I have to eat fast. Big day.
Is it? Well, I'll probably be done soon too. Maybe I could help you.

Fields.MenuText: It's nothing I need your help with. Just bureaucratic stuff.
If you want to, I guess. You might get bored, though.
Just keep to your balance beams and cartwheels. I'll be the captain, all right?

Fields.DialogueText: Bureaucratic stuff? Yeah, no thanks. I'm sure you can handle that on your own.
I'm sure I can find something to keep myself entertained. Though I suppose that wouldn't be much help to you, now would it?
It's unfortunate that you're so rude. I rescind my offer, then.
Yeah, exactly. So anyway, I have to eat this as fast as possible and get out of here.
I see...
Well, I need to hurry, too. You never know when Funayūrei will attack.
You're eating awfully quickly, Ikazuchi.
Am I?
Wait... are you trying to race me now? At eating?
... Maybe. Why? Are you afraid you're losing?
No. I'm done.
That's cheating! Your plate is still half full.
I'm not participating in this strange contest. I'll just throw the rest of this away.
... Wasteful cheater.
@BATTLE
Ikazuchi, what are you doing this time?
The splits. It's kind of obvious.
On the railing of the deck?
I'm working on my balance and flexibility at the same time. Do you need something, or do you want to get me off the railing?

Fields.MenuText: I have something I'd like to speak to you about, but if you're too busy with all this gymnastics stuff, it can wait.
I mostly wanted to make sure you didn't fall off the edge, but I do have something on my mind.
I have a mission for you. I hope you're ready, because it sounds like a big one.

Fields.DialogueText: For me, this takes up as much of my attention as breathing does for you. So go right ahead.
I'm a Belle, and I have perfect balance. The only way I'd fall into the ocean is if I wanted to. Now, what's going on?
A mission? Well, I hope it's a good one. One that's perfect for my particular set of skills.
I heard from one of my contacts in the west that there are powerful Morganas terrorizing the area. Most ships aren't even able to get close to them.
What do you mean? They can't get close? Why? Are the Funayūrei too quick?
I don't know, really. I just have a location.
Well, what are we waiting for? Let's go.
*ALARM*
Looks like we have something else to take care of first.
A little practice for the main event can't hurt.
@BATTLE
And one and two, and three and two, and one and two, and three!

Fields.MenuText: I can't believe I'm doing this.
This is more fun than I thought it'd be.
You do this... every day? I'm... already out of breath.

Fields.DialogueText: Come on, Kanchou, you've got to keep up.
Right? I knew you'd enjoy it, Kanchou.
You'll get used to it before long, or you won't. Only one way to find out.
What do you think about joining us more often?
If I'm not too busy.
I'll make sure you're not, then.
I'll remind you that you said that the next time there's a mountain of paperwork on my desk.
*ALARM*
Sounds like we have Funayūrei coming to visit. You think they're here to participate in calisthenics as well?
Either that, or they're here to devour us, like usual.
@BATTLE
Enemy spotted off the port beam!  Battle stations, everyone!
@BATTLE
Phew. Well, that battle certainly worked up a sweat.
Getting tired, Ikazuchi?
Everyone has their limits, though I still have a long way to go before I'm truly spent.

Fields.MenuText: Well, I've certainly reached my limit.
I know what you mean. I feel like I could go a while longer too.
Well, all right, then! Let's look for other Morganas nearby.

Fields.DialogueText: There's no shame in that. It's actually good that you know.
Really? I'm glad to hear that from my kanchou.
No need to be so hasty. I'm not sure the rest of the crew would appreciate another battle so soon after the last.
All right, well, I'm going to go take a breather in my office.
I'll race you there.
Race me? *sigh* Are you still trying to beat me at something?
O-of course not! I'm just...
I'm sorry if I hurt your pride earlier, Ikazuchi, but I'm not going to compete with you around the clock.
I'm going to beat you, Kanchou. Just you wait.
So that's our target?
Yes. Those reports weren't exaggerated. Those are huge Morganas over there.
But...  they're not moving. I mean, they must see us, but they're not approaching like most Funayūrei would.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe they're getting smarter.
Maybe they're scared of us.
What do you think?

Fields.DialogueText: Smarter? Maybe. I doubt that will make them any more difficult to hit, though.
I doubt that. We probably look like an insect to them.
I'm thinking that if these Funayūrei are supposed to be so hard to touch, what are they doing sitting out in the open like that?
We won't know anything until we engage.
You're right about that, but are you sure you're up for it?
If anyone is going to defeat these Funayūrei, it's me. We're probably the only ship fast enough.
All right, then let's speed ahead.
@BATTLE
What did those things shoot at us?
Some really powerful... cannons, maybe.
Whatever they were, they were powerful.
Next time, we'll need to get closer if we want to avoid those guns and do some real damage.

Fields.MenuText: Closer? Are you crazy?
Are you sure that's the best tactic here?

Fields.DialogueText: No, they wouldn't be able to use that massive gun in a short range setting.
It's the only tactic. Trust me, Kanchou.
All right, we move in and we—
*BOOM*
Ahhhhhh!
Ikazuchi?! Damn, you're hurt. We need to get out of here!
No! I'm fine. Just surprised by that salvo...
Morganas are flanking us. What do we do, Captain?
I'd rather try and take those smaller Morganas than deal with those big ones. Engage that group over there!
@BATTLE
How you doing, Ikazuchi? They told me you're been ordered to rest for the time being.
I can still somersault through the halls... just a bit sore.

Fields.MenuText: Dear God, I hope not.
Good. Keep those spirits high.
I hope so, but let's make sure you're okay.

Fields.DialogueText: Please, you need me at my best, Kanchou!
They're even higher now that I get the chance to prove you wrong.
I could *grunt* do some backflips right now, you know, if I wanted to...
Just keep dodging gunfire. That would be enough.
I can take a hit, you know.
They could have sunk us, Ikazuchi. Accept it.
I don't have to accept it.
I was fine!
*ALARM*
I've got to go take care of that.
Give me a second. I'll get dressed and join you.
Don't make me restrain you.
I'd like to see you try.
@BATTLE
Ikazuchi, what are you doing out of bed? You need your rest!
I already told you, I'm fine. I'd be cartwheeling this very moment if... if I felt like it.

Fields.MenuText: You won't get rid of that back pain without some rest.
You're a Belle, right? Next time just phase through the explosion.
If you really think you're okay, then work through the pain.

Fields.DialogueText: Yeah, yeah, I already heard it all from the infirmary.
It doesn't work that way, Kanchou. At least, I don't think it does...
I'll be fine. I have mobility, just some pain. I can put up with this for now.
How much pain are you in?
You don't need to worry about me, Kanchou, though I do appreciate it. The explosion didn't kill me.
*ALARM*
That's good to hear. Do you think you're feeling up to a little scuffle?
I think it's about time I got back in the fight.
@BATTLE
Everybody's looking good! Let's keep going. One... two... three...
Ikazuchi, are you all right?
I... I just got a little lightheaded for a moment there.
I knew it wasn't a good idea for you to be leading calisthenics so soon.
Do you think you could lead everyone for a little while? Just finish up the session.

Fields.MenuText: I-I'm not sure I can do that.
Yeah, right. Like I could do this as well as you.
Sure, I can cover for you. Just sit back and try to feel better.

Fields.DialogueText: I have faith that you can handle this, Kanchou.
You don't need to be as good as me. You just need to finish the class.
Thank you, Kanchou. I'll be fine, I just have to...  catch my breath.
All right, let's finish this up. One and two, and three and two, and one and two, and three!
Some Time Later
Phew, that was really good, everyone. That's it for the day!
Good job, Kanchou. I knew you had it under control.
You're looking a little better.
I don't know what was wrong with me. I must not have eaten enough.
Or, you know, the explosion could have something to do with it.
No, I don't think so. But speaking of explosions, I'm sensing some Funayūrei to our north that we should blow out of the water.
*sigh* You really are feeling better.
@BATTLE
Tsk, ouch. My back still hurts...
Feeling some pain there, Ikazuchi?
No more than usual, Kanchou. I can deal with it.
What are you taking for the pain?
You mean drugs? None. I don't trust them. They have side effects that could affect my body in nightmarish ways.

Fields.MenuText: Okay, I think you're overreacting.
Really? I wasn't aware of that.
I suppose that's admirable.

Fields.DialogueText: Overreacting? I don't drink, smoke, eat unhealthy foods, or take drugs. I treat my body like the temple it is.
They warn you about all the side effects. It's right there on the bottle. Read it occasionally. You'll be shocked.
I'm not sure whether I should be flattered or offended.
I guess It's your choice. Just remember they're there, if you ever change our mind.
I won't. And you don't need to worry about me being in pain. I'm actually feeling a lot better already.
Really?
*ALARM*
If you don't believe me, then you can just watch and I'll prove it.
Hey, don't do anything crazy!
@BATTLE
Kanchou, it's time to duel!
I'm sorry, what?
I am issuing a formal request to engage you in a competition that will determine which one of us is...  I'm challenging you to a duel!

Fields.MenuText: You're still recovering, aren't you?
This again? When are you going to give it up?
Okay, if only to finally settle this competitive thing you've got going with me.

Fields.DialogueText: I can take you any day, Kanchou!
I don't give up. You should already know that.
That's what I like to hear.
Why do you care so much?
You have beaten me too many times using underhanded methods. This will be a fair, one on one duel where a firm winner will be determined.
Okay, so how are we going to duel, then?
That's up to you. I'm issuing the challenge. You determine the method.
So I can pick anything? Even a game of rock-paper-scissors?
I suppose. It's completely up to you.
Hmmm, I'll need some time to figure that out, then.
All right, but don't take too long. I'll be waiting.
This could be interesting.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, look! I've made a complete recovery!
Really? That was fast. Faster than any human would heal from an injury like that, that's for sure.
Treat your body right and it treats you right in return.

Fields.MenuText: I'm not sure that's how that works, but okay.
Or Belles have preternatural healing abilities.
I guess next time I get hurt, I won't take anything for the pain either.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't doubt it before you try it, Kanchou.
You make a good point. Still, I stand by my initial statement.
I wouldn't suggest going cold turkey, but I'm glad you're receptive to the idea.
Now, when are we going to go back and take on those massive Funayūrei?
You mean the cannoneers? You really want to go back?
Yes! We're the only ones who stand a chance of getting close enough to take them down.
They blew you up.
I'm still in one piece. I'm fine, and we can do this, Kanchou.
If you're so sure, we can head back that way. But let's take our time and sharpen our blades on some weaker Morganas first.
I'm all for that, Kanchou.
@BATTLE
All right, everyone, great job today. I'll see you all tomorrow!
You know what? That session wasn't too hard.
Starting to get used to it, huh, Kanchou? I hope that means you're now a permanent member of our little group.

Fields.MenuText: I wouldn't go that far.
Yeah, why not? I've been having fun.
No way. Just calm down there, Ikazuchi.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, you will, I'm sure.
That's great to hear. You won't regret it, Kanchou.
I'll make a healthy person out of you yet, Kanchou. Just you wait and see.
*ALARM*
What timing. You think it waited for us to finish before attacking?
Maybe your shouting intimidated it.
I'm not that loud, am I?
Kanchou? Wait! Why aren't you answering me?
@BATTLE
All right, Ikazuchi. I've figured out the particulars of our duel.
You did? Well, let's do it! I have nothing else going on at the moment.
We should wait until after we fight those Morganas. We're getting pretty close to them already.
You make a good point, but you can at least let me know what you decided.

Fields.MenuText: No way. You've got to wait.
Sure, I guess I can tell you that much.
Why do you want to know? I would think you confident you could beat me no matter the challenge.

Fields.DialogueText: You know you want to tell me. Otherwise, you wouldn't have brought it up.
Exactly! There's no harm in telling me now.
I'm just curious, Kanchou. But rest assured, I will beat you. You can count on that.
Okay, I'm challenging you to a game of tic-tac-toe.
Tic-tac-what?
You've never heard of it? It's also called noughts and crosses by our British crewmates.
No.
That puts you at a bit of a disadvantage, then, hmmm?
I have some research to do.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Those Morganas are just as huge as I remember. And it looks as if they've brought in a few friends this time.
I don't really remember them being that scary looking.
Well, you hit your head pretty hard last time we were here.
You make a good point. Are you clear on the plan?

Fields.MenuText: We get as close as possible as fast as possible, right?
We avoid those guns at all costs.
Nope.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, but we also need to be ready to evade those guns, so it doesn't take off a piece of our hull again.
Yes, but we need to keep moving in close, too. Otherwise, we'll just be running all day.
*sigh* We just need to keep moving and get close, okay?
All right, everyone, man your stations! Top speed! Let's engage those smaller Funayūrei! And remember, we can't let the big ones hit us!
Try not to get blown up again.
I'll do my best, Kanchou.
@BATTLE
Got it. Now I remember.
We're up close and personal, Ikazuchi!
I can see that. I could nearly reach out and touch them if I tried.

Fields.MenuText: It's a lot scarier this close, isn't it?
We're going to win this thing!
How's the ship doing?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh yeah, but so are we!
Don't get cocky, Kanchou.
We've taken a couple hits, but we should be good enough to take these Funayūrei down!
Okay, we're close enough now that the massive cannons are no longer a threat, but we still need to worry about the rest of their armament.
Those guns are nothing that we haven't seen before. We just need to keep moving. She won't be able to touch us.
Just remember not to put too much distance between us and them!
Got it, Kanchou!
@BATTLE
They're down!
I told you we could do it!
I never doubted you. I'm just a little shocked they didn't take us down with them.
They still might. Let's get out of here, fast. I don't like the way those guns are moving.
All right, let's do this, Kanchou. Our tic-tac-toe duel.
This looks much more official than I thought it would be.
Well, we have to make sure no one cheats.
Don't look at me like that. I don't cheat.
Mhmmmm.
I do, however, have a secret technique that will guarantee my victory.
We'll see about that. Just sit down and let's play.
Okay, let's play.
All right... Tic, Tac, Toe!

Fields.MenuText: [Use your secret technique.]
[Let her win.]

Fields.DialogueText: You... you beat me again.
Haha! Nice try, Kanchou, but bang, three Xs in a row. I win.
Well, it was a good game. You just need a little more practice.
You cheated. Somehow, I know it.
It was a good game.
Best of three?
